pluginBase Class Reference

A plugin base class to handle file transfer to and from the config server, The class can be instructed to fetch a number of files, will block while they are fetched and if you mark them as dirty will notify you when they need saving and upload them for you. More...

class configFile

Detailed Description

A plugin base class to handle file transfer to and from the config server, The class can be instructed to fetch a number of files, will block while they are fetched and if you mark them as dirty will notify you when they need saving and upload them for you.

Member Function Documentation

Add a menu to be shown when this plugin is visible.

virtual void pluginBase::deinit (  QCloseEvent *  ce  )  [inline, protected, virtual]
 

Sub classes should override this. Called when the plugin should de-initialise. The subclass must accept or reject the close event

void pluginBase::doLoadFile (  configFile &  f  ) 
 

Send a request to the subclass to load a file. Mark it as such internally.

Parameters:
f (configFile &) The configFile object representing the file to be loaded

void pluginBase::doSaveFile (  configFile &  f  ) 
 

Send a request to the subclass to save a file. Mark it as such internally.

Parameters:
f (configFile &) The configFile object representing the file to be saved

configFile & pluginBase::file (  QString  s  ) 
 

Return a configFile object by name. This is the usual method of interacting with the class. For example: 

 file("config/instances.xml").download();
 file("config/instances.xml").wait();

Conversion to QFile is also supported with the QFile set up with the correct parameters for local access. Eg: 

 QFile f = file("config/instances.xml");
 f.open( IO_Append );
Parameters:
s (QString) The name of the file.
Returns:
(configFile&) An object on which operations can be performed.

virtual void pluginBase::init (   )  [inline, protected, virtual]
 

Subclasses should override this. It will be called when the plugin should initialise its self.

virtual void pluginBase::loadFile (  QString  sFile  )  [inline, protected, virtual]
 

Sub classes should override this. Called when the plugin should load a file from disk

virtual void pluginBase::saveFile (  QString  sFile  )  [inline, protected, virtual]
 

Subclasses should override this. Called when the plugin should save a file. The file that requires saving is passed in. If the plugin also wishes to save other files at this time it may do so and mark those files as clean using setClean(). It will not then be asked to save those files.

Parameters:
sFile (QString) The file that needs saving.

bool pluginBase::waitForAllFiles (   ) 
 

Blocks until all pending file operations have completed.

Returns:
(bool) true if all operations completed succesfully else false
